page.title: 01WRITTLE, AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Writtle is a semi rural village about 4km. west of Chelmsford in the county of Essex. Some of the interesting features in the village are The Green, the church, the Agricultural College and King John's Hunting Lodge, which is now part of the college. Writtle is mainly a residential area with little employment centred in the village itself. The only employment based in the village either concerns the college or Marconi's Writtle was mentioned in the original Domesday Book and was then quite an important village in its own right. Whereas now it is really a satellite of Chelmsford.
